forge.card.cardFactory
Class CardFactory

java.lang.Object
  forge.card.cardFactory.CardFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
NewConstants, Iterable<Card>
public class CardFactory
extends Object
implements NewConstants, Iterable<Card>

CardFactory class.

TODO: The map field contains Card instances that have not gone through getCard2, and thus lack abilities. However, when a new Card is requested via getCard, it is this map's values that serve as the templates for the values it returns. This class has another field, allCards, which is another copy of the card database. These cards have abilities attached to them, and are owned by the human player by default. It would be better memory-wise if we had only one or the other. We may experiment in the future with using allCard-type values for the map instead of the less complete ones that exist there today.

Version:
$Id: $
Author:
Forge

Method Detail

getAllCards

public CardList getAllCards()
Deprecated. Use iterator and make your own copy, if you absolutely need one. Keep in mind that there are thousands of cards, so it is a very heap-intensive operation.

Makes a shallow copy of the internal card list (allCards).

Returns:
a shallow copy of the internal card list
See Also:
iterator()

getCards

public CardList getCards()
Deprecated. use iterator

Faster than getAllCards, but callers must not modify this list directly!

Returns:
the internal CardList object -- do not modify!
See Also:
iterator()

iterator

getRandomCombinationWithoutRepetition

public CardList getRandomCombinationWithoutRepetition(int numCards)
Fetch a random combination of cards without any duplicates. This algorithm is reasonably fast if numCards is small. If it is larger than, say, size()/10, it starts to get noticeably slow.

Parameters:
numCards - the number of cards to return
Returns:
a list of fleshed-out card instances
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if numCards >= size()/4
